question_sets.context:
Mary: Hello John. I know you love sports very much. But what did you use to like? John: Well. Actually I used to listen to music very often. And still now I like music very much especially pop music. Tom: Yes, but now I have no time to play so I don't love it anymore. Now I prefer reading books. Mary, I will return the books to you soon. I know you read books every day. Mary: OK. I have another book to read now so don't worry about it. Tom: Thanks a lot. You know I used to watch TV almost every night but now I don't. I have enough time to finish the book. And I want another book to read later on.

"Fire! Fire!" I was woken up by terrible words in the middle of the night. It was a large, old wooden building and my room was on the top floor. I jumped out of bed, opened the door and came into the passage(走廊), but it was full of thick smoke.
I began to run downstairs. When I got to the second floor, I found the smoke grew thicker and the fire was terribly big. The floor became hot under my feet. I saw an open door and rushed into a room. I decided to jump out of the window.
Before I could reach the window, one of my feet touched something soft and I fell down. The thing was like a pack of clothes. I picked it up to protect my face from the smoke.
I cried for help at the window, many people noticed me and they put many soft things on the ground. Then I jumped out of the window.
I was safe again when I reached the cold air outside. Suddenly, a young woman in a night-dress screamed as she saw me and ran to me quickly.
"My baby! My baby!" she cried. Many people cheered loudly when the woman took "the pack of clothes" out of my arms.
To my surprise, there was a baby in it. I saved a baby, and I was a hero! They all thought Miss Lucy was a hero!

questions.explanation: In the last paragraph, it is mentioned that they all thought Miss Lucy was a hero.
The first sentence mentions the fire, indicating the building was on fire.
In the last paragraph, it is mentioned that the thing was a baby.
The people cheered loudly because the baby was rescued from the fire.

As she walked around the biggest mall, Nancy realized how difficult it was to choose a Christmas present for her father. She wished that he was as easy to please as her mother. Her mother was only interested in perfume(香水).
There were many people in the shopping mall; all of them were busy buying presents, especially the things on discount. Nancy stopped in front of a counter. There were many beautiful ties. "They are real silk," the assistant told her. "Should I buy him a tie?" Nancy thought. Suddenly, she remembered she had bought a tie for him last year, but he wasn't pleased at all. She gave up <blank> at last.
She went on and noticed a small counter. She found some good quality pipes on sale―but the prices were very high. Nancy didn't think for long: his father liked smoking a pipe; she knew this would be a good present for him.
Then she got home with her small but well-chosen present in her bag. Her parents were having supper. Her mother was very happy when she saw her daughter, "I can't wait to tell you the good news, your father has decided to stop smoking."

question_sets.context:
The Chinese New Year is now known as the Spring Festival because it starts from the beginning of spring. Though there are some sayings about <blank text=its> (它的) origin(起源), all agree that the word Nian, which in <blank text=modern> (现代的) Chinese means "year", was originally the name of a beast(野兽) that started to eat people the <blank text=night> (夜) before the beginning of a new year.
One story goes that the beast Nian had a very big <blank text=mouth> (嘴巴) that would take in a great many people at one time. People were very <blank text=afraid> (害怕). One day, an old man came to help them and said that he would all this. To Nian he said, " I <blank text=hear> (听说) that you are very strong, but can you eat up all the beasts on earth <blank text=instead> (代替) of people who are too weak to be your enemy(敌人)?" "Yes," Nian <blank text=agreed> (同意) with him and went to kill many of the beasts on earth. People were very happy because these beasts <blank text=also> (也) did bad things to people and killed their farm <blank text=animals> (动物) from time to time.

questions.explanation: The possessive pronoun 'its' is needed to refer to the origin of the Chinese New Year.
The adjective 'modern' is needed to describe the type of Chinese.
The noun 'night' is needed to indicate the time before the new year.
The noun 'mouth' is needed to describe the beast's physical feature.
The adjective 'afraid' is needed to describe the people's emotion.
The verb 'hear' is needed to express that the old man has heard about Nian's strength.
The adverb 'instead' is needed to express the substitution of eating beasts for eating people.
The verb 'agreed' is needed to show that Nian accepted the old man's suggestion.
The adverb 'also' is needed to show that the beasts did bad things as well.
The noun 'animals' is needed to describe what the beasts killed.

question_sets.context:
动词不定式是一种活跃的非谓语动词.它在句中起的是名词.形容词或副词的作用,可在句子中作主语,宾语,定语,状语和宾语补足语.动词不定式的形式是"to +动词原形",但to有时要省去.动词不定式在具体运用时,用不用to,取决于谓语动词的用法:
一.带to的不定式结构
1.我们学过的能直接跟带to的不定式结构的动词主要有:want, ask, tell, hope, learn, try, decide, forget, remember, like ,love, stop, go, come等.
2.动词不定式的否定形式是在不定式前直接加not,即not to do sth..例如:
Jim told me not to wake up Kate.吉姆告诉我别叫醒凯特.
二.不带to的不定式结构
以下几种情况使用不带to的动词不定式:
1.在固定词组had better之后.注意:had better的否定形式是had better not do sth..例如:
You had better go home now.你最好现在回家.
It's cold outside. You'd better not go out.外面很冷,你最好不要出去.
2.在let,make,see, feel, watch,hear等感官或使役动词后,要跟不带to的动词不定式作宾语补足语.例如:
I made them give me the money back.我迫使他们把钱还给我.
I didn't see you come in.我没看见你进来.
3.在引导疑问句的why not之后.
"Why not+不带to的不定式"是Why don't you do…的省略,可以用来提出建议或劝告.例如:
Why not go with us.为什么不和我们一起去呢.
Why not take a holiday.=Why don't you take a holiday.为什么不休个假呢.
三.动词不定式作 <blank> _
不定式结构作主语时,现代英语倾向于采用it作形式主语,而把不定式结构后置的形式.
四,动词不定式作定语
不定式作定语,要放在它所修饰的名词或代词的后面.例如:
I have nothing to say on this question.对这个问题我无可奉告.
五.动词不定式作宾语
有的及物动词要求跟复合宾语(即宾语+宾语补足语).如果其中的宾语是不定式短语,则必须将形式宾语it放在宾语的位置上,而将不定式短语(真正的宾语)放在宾语补足语之前.例如:
I find it useful to learn English well.我发现学好英语很有用.
We thought it wrong not to tell her.我们认为不告诉她是错误的.
六.动词不定式作宾语补足语
动词不定式作宾语补足语是动词不定式用法的一个重点,学习时要注意以下三种情况:
1.作动词ask, like, tell等的宾语补足语时,动词不定式符号to不可以省略.例如:
He asked me to talk about English study.他请我谈谈英语学习.
2.作使役动词let, have, make以及感官动词feel, hear, see, watch等的宾语补足语时,动词不定式符号to要省略.例如:
The teacher made him say the word like this.老师让他像这样说这个单词.
3.作动词help的宾语补足语时,动词不定式符号to可以带,也可以不带.例如:
Could you help me (to) carry the heavy box.你能帮我搬这个重箱子吗.
七.动词不定式作状语
动词不定式及其短语具有副词的特性,可在句中用作状语.
1.放在句首也可以放在句尾表示目的等.例如: He stopped to have a rest.他停下来休息.
2.跟在作表语的形容词或过去分词的后面.例如:
I'm sorry to hear that.听到这事我感到很难过.
3.用在too... to...结构中.例如:
He is too young to understand all that.他太年轻了,不能理解这件事.

questions.explanation: According to the context, the blank should be filled with "主语".

question_sets.context: The Birth of American Football A hundred years <blank text=1> , the game we now call football did not exist . American football started <blank text=2> a game between two colleges . The teams had gotten together to play what they called "football", but each team played by different rules . One team played what we now call soccer (英式足球). The other played what we now call rugby (橄榄球) Both games had been invented a thousand years <blank text=3> . In the first kind of football game ever played , all the men <blank text=4> one village tried to kick a ball <blank text=5> another village . The men of the second village tried to kick the ball into the first . Hundreds of people joined in running everywhere , ruining (毁坏)crops and knocking down fences . In time , people agreed on some rules to keep order , but many rules were left open to change . Different rules developed in different places . When the two colleges met to play football , each followed its own rules . They mixed the games together and invented a new game . A hundred years <blank text=6> we call that game American football.
